Instead, the client should query on the collection resource with a filter to navigate to a specific resource item. For example: products?q=InventoryItemId=<value1>

query.description: When this parameter is provided, the specified children are included in the resource payload (instead of just a link). The value of this query parameter is "all" or "". More than one child can be specified using comma as a separator. Example: ?expand=Employees,Localizations. Nested children can also be provided following the format "Child.NestedChild" (Example: ?expand=Employees.Managers). If a nested child is provided (Example: Employees.Managers), the missing children will be processed implicitly. For example, "?expand=Employees.Managers" is the same as "?expand=Employees,Employees.Managers" (which will expand Employees and Managers).

This parameter filters the resource fields. Only the specified fields are returned, which means that if no fields are specified, no fields are returned (useful to get only the links). If an indirect child resource is provided (Example: Employees.Managers), the missing children will be processed implicitly. For example, "?fields=Employees.Managers:Empname" is the same as "?fields=;Employees:;Employees.Managers:Empname" (which will only return the "Empname" field for Managers). the value of this query parameter is a list of resource fields. The attribute can be a direct (Example: Employees) or indirect (Example: Employees.Managers) child. It cannot be combined with expand query parameter. If both are provided, only fields will be considered.

Format: ?fields=Attribute1,Attribute2

Format for fields in child resource: ?fields=Accessor1:Attribute1,Attribute2
The resource item payload will be filtered in order to contain only data (no links section, for example).

This parameter restricts the number of resources returned inside the resource collection. If the limit exceeds the resource count then the framework will only return the available resources.
Used to define the starting position of the resource collection. If offset exceeds the resource count then no resources are returned. Default value is 0.
The resource collection representation will include the "estimated row count" when "?totalResults=true", otherwise the count is not included.  The default value is "false".

Format: ?q=expression1;expression2

You can use these queryable attributes to filter this collection resource using the q query parameter:
  • geolocationEnabledFlag; boolean; Indicates whether the geolocation is enabled for Web Clock. Valid values are true and false. The default value is false.
  • layoutSetId; integer; Unique identifier for the layout set.
  • layoutSetName; string; Name of the layout set.

This parameter orders a resource collection based on the specified fields.  The parameter value is a comma-separated string of attribute names, each optionally followed by a colon and "asc" or "desc".  Specify "asc" for ascending and "desc" for descending. The default value is "asc".  For example, ?orderBy=field1:asc,field2:desc

Used as a predefined finder to search the collection.

Format ?finder=<finderName>;<variableName>=<variableValue>,<variableName2>=<variableValue2>

The following are the available finder names and corresponding finder variables

  • PrimaryKey Finds the layout set using the specified primary key criteria.
    Finder Variables
    • layoutSetId; integer; Unique identifier for the layout set.
  • findByPersonIdAndEffectiveDate Finds all the layout sets based on the specified criteria.
    Finder Variables
    • effectiveDate; string; Effective date as of when to retrieve layout sets.
    • personId; string; Unique identifier for the person.

  • administratorDataSourceId; integer; Unique identifier for the administrator data source.
  • allowChangeRequestFlag; boolean; Indicates whether a change can be requested for a time card field value. Valid values are true and false. The default value is false.
  • alternateNameId; integer; Unique identifier for the alternate name in the multiattribute time card field.
  • attributeDataType; string; Data type for the attribute from the time card field, such as VARCHAR and NUMBER.
  • attributeFieldId; integer; Unique identifier for the time card field.
  • bindTcfId1; integer; Bind variable for the identifier of the time card field 1.
  • bindTcfId2; integer; Bind variable for the identifier of the time card field 2.
  • bindTcfId3; integer; Bind variable for the identifier of the time card field 3.
  • bindTcfId4; integer; Bind variable for the identifier of the time card field 4.
  • bindTcfId5; integer; Bind variable for the identifier of the time card field 5.
  • defaultValue; string; Default value for the time card field.
  • defaultValueDisplay; string; Default display value for the time card field.
  • defaultValueUOM; string; Unit of measure for the time card field default value, such as hours or units.
  • displayName; string; Display name for the time card field.
  • displaySequence; integer; Unique identifier for the sequence of the time card field.
  • displayType; string; Display type for the time card field, such as Hidden or SmartChoiceList.
  • formatBasedFlag; boolean; Indicates whether the time card field is format based. Valid values are true and false. The default value is false.
  • formatSubType; string; Subtype for the time card field format, such as Text, Numeric digits only, or Time.
  • function; string; Function used to populate a time card field for a new time entry, such as based on data source first value.
  • functionBasedOnAnother; string; Function used to populate the time card field based on another time card field.
  • maximumLength; integer; Maximum length for the time card field.
  • maximumValue; integer; Maximum value for the time card field.
  • minimumValue; integer; Minimum value for the time card field.
  • requiredFlag; boolean; Indicates whether the time card field is required. Valid values are true and false. The default value is false.
  • restURI; string; REST URI for the time card field.
  • scale; integer; Scale for the time card field.
  • specificValue; string; Specific value applied to the time card field for a new time entry.
  • timeAttributeName; string; Name of the time attribute associated with the time card field.
  • timeCardFieldId; number; Unique identifier for the time card field.
  • timeCardFieldType; string; Type for the time card field, such as single or multiple attribute field.
  • unitOfMeasure; string; Unit of measure for the time card field, such as HOURS or UNITS.
  • userDataSourceId; integer; Unique identifier for the user data source.
